00013 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00014 // Definition of the semaphore used by the scheduler.
00015 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00016 class xSEMA
00017 {
00018 protected:
00019 
00020     enum { semaUNLOCKED  = -1 };
00021 
00022     bool isMutex;
00023     xTaskHandle* pxMutexHolder;
00024 
00025     // The number of items currently in the semaphore.
00026     //
00027     volatile signed portBASE_TYPE xItemCount;
00028 
00029     // Stores the number of items transmitted to the semaphore (added to the sema) 
00030     // while the semaphore was locked. Set to semaUNLOCKED when the semaphore is 
00031     // not locked.
00032     //
00033     signed portBASE_TYPE xTxLock;  
00034 
00035     // List of tasks that are blocked waiting to read from this semaphore.
00036     // Stored in priority order.
00037     //
00038     xList xTasksWaitingToReceive; 
00039 
00040     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041     // Function to mark a semaphore as locked. Locking a semaphore prevents an ISR from
00042     // accessing the semaphore event lists.
00043     //
00044     inline void Lock( void )
00045     {
00046         taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00047         ++xTxLock;
00048         taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00049     }
00050 
00051     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052     // Unlocks a semaphore locked by a call to Lock(). Locking a semaphore does not
00053     // prevent an ISR from adding or removing items to the sema, but does prevent
00054     // an ISR from removing tasks from the semaphore event lists. If an ISR finds a
00055     // semaphore is locked it will instead increment the appropriate semaphore lock count
00056     // to indicate that a task may require unblocking. When the semaphore in unlocked
00057     // these lock counts are inspected, and the appropriate action taken.
00058     // THIS FUNCTION MUST BE CALLED WITH THE SCHEDULER SUSPENDED.
00059     // 
00060     inline void Unlock( void )
00061     {
00062         // The lock counts contains the number of extra items placed or
00063         // removed from the semaphore while the semaphore was locked. When a semaphore is
00064         // locked items can be added or removed, but the event lists cannot be
00065         // updated.
00066         //
00067         taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00068         
00069         --xTxLock;
00070 
00071         // See if items were added to the semaphore while it was locked.
00072         //
00073         if( xTxLock > semaUNLOCKED )
00074         {
00075             xTxLock = semaUNLOCKED;
00076 
00077             // Items were posted while the semaphore was locked. Are any tasks
00078             // blocked waiting for items to become available?
00079             //
00080             if( ! listLIST_IS_EMPTY( &xTasksWaitingToReceive ) )
00081             {
00082                 // Tasks that are removed from the event list will get added to
00083                 // the pending ready list as the scheduler is still suspended.
00084                 //
00085                 if( xTaskRemoveFromEventList( &xTasksWaitingToReceive ) != pdFALSE )
00086                 {
00087                     // The task waiting has a higher priority so record that a
00088                     // context switch is required.
00089                     //
00090                     vTaskMissedYield ();
00091                 }
00092             }           
00093         }
00094         
00095         taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00096     }
00097 
00098     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099     // Uses a critical section to determine if there is certain amount of items in 
00100     // the semaphore.
00101     // \return pdTRUE if the semaphore contains items less than needed, otherwise pdFALSE.
00102     //
00103     inline bool DoesSemaContains( unsigned portBASE_TYPE count ) const
00104     {
00105         taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00106         bool rc = xItemCount >= (signed portBASE_TYPE)count;
00107         taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00108         return rc;
00109     }
00110 
00111 public:
00112 
00113     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00114     // Returns current semaphore count
00115     //
00116     inline unsigned portBASE_TYPE GetCount( void ) const
00117     {
00118         taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00119         unsigned portBASE_TYPE uxReturn = xItemCount;
00120         taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00121         return uxReturn;
00122     }
00123 
00124     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00125     static void* operator new( size_t size );
00126 
00127     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128     static void operator delete( void* p );
00129 
00130     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00131     xSEMA( unsigned portBASE_TYPE uxInitialCount = 0 );
00132 
00133     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134     void Release( unsigned portBASE_TYPE count = 1 );
00135 
00136     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00137     signed portBASE_TYPE ReleaseFromISR( unsigned portBASE_TYPE count, 
00138             signed portBASE_TYPE xTaskPreviouslyWoken );
00139 
00140     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141     signed portBASE_TYPE Wait( unsigned portBASE_TYPE count, portTickType xTicksToWait, 
00142             portBASE_TYPE xJustPeeking = pdFALSE );
00143 
00144     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145     signed portBASE_TYPE WaitFromISR( unsigned portBASE_TYPE count );
00146 };
00147 
00148 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00149 // Definition of the mutex used by the scheduler.
00150 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00151 class xMUTEX : public xSEMA
00152 {
00153 public:
00154 
00155     xMUTEX( void )
00156         : xSEMA( 1 )
00157     {
00158         isMutex = true; 
00159     }
00160 
00161     bool Lock( const portTickType waitTicks )
00162     {
00163         return Wait( 1, waitTicks );
00164     }
00165 
00166     void Unlock( void )
00167     {
00168         Release( 1 );
00169     }
00170 };
